comments:
I am running on a platform that does not have an internal web browser (REL 3). Ironically, I went to the General>Web Browser preference page to see if the help offered any explanation of how to get a valid browser. I was able to open the Help Tray but clicking on any link resulting in the following NPE. The preference to use an external browser is enabled but an attempt to use the internal browser was made.

eclipse.buildId=I20060428-1315
java.fullversion=J2RE 1.4.2 IBM build cxia32142-20050609 (JIT enabled: jitc)
BootLoader constants: OS=linux, ARCH=x86, WS=gtk, NL=en_US
Command-line arguments:  -os linux -ws gtk -arch x86 -debug -consolelog

Michael, I think this may have been fixed since 3.2 as I was looking at a similar bug recently. Either way the stack trace does not line up with the code properly anymore.

Do you still have an environment to test this easily? If it's reproducible could you paste the new stack trace?

It would take me a bit of time to retest since I don't use GTK regularly and I am fairly busy right now. I would say that you can close this as a worksforme. I'll keep it on my list of things to try out the next time I test on GTK and I will reopen it then if it is still a problem.
